subject: Climate & Environment
title: Coral Reefs Under Acid Stress
description: A micro-lesson that makes Coral Reefs Under Acid Stress usable.

hook.text: Corals build their skeletons from calcium carbonate. Acidification makes that harder every year.

buildup.text: Reefs already face bleaching from heat. Acidification adds a second, simultaneous threat.

discovery.text: Under more acidic conditions, corals grow slower and their skeletons become brittle and porous.

twist.text: At a pH of 7.8 â€” possible by 2100 â€” coral reefs would dissolve faster than they can grow.

climax.text: Losing reefs means losing the 25% of marine species that depend on them for survival.

punchline.text: Heat bleaches them. Acid dissolves them. Corals are under siege from both sides.

quiz.question: What is the combined threat to coral reefs from warming and acidification?
options: Heat bleaches corals while acid weakens their skeletons
Both cause corals to grow faster
